reg:regulation.reg:effective:
Part 1 and sections 7.1 and 7.2 effective
February 6, 2003; remainder effective March 31, 2003
reg:regulation.reg:title:
National Instrument 31-102
National Registration Database
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 210/2013, December 2, 2013]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: authorized firm representative or AFR means, for a firm filer, an individual with his or her own NRD user ID and who is authorized by the firm filer to submit information in NRD format for that firm filer and individual filers with respect to whom the firm filer is the sponsoring firm;
chief AFR means, for a firm filer, an individual who is an AFR and has accepted an appointment as a chief AFR by the firm filer;

firm filer means a person or company that is required under securities legislation to make an NRD submission in accordance with this Instrument and that is registered as, or has applied for registration as, a dealer, adviser, or investment fund manager;
NI 33-109 means National Instrument 33-109 Registration Information;

National Registration Database or NRD means the online electronic database of registration information regarding NRD filers and includes the computer system providing for the transmission, receipt, review and dissemination of that registration information by electronic means;
NRD filer means an individual filer or a firm filer;
NRD format means the electronic format for submitting information through the NRD website;
NRD number means the unique number first generated by NRD to identify an NRD filer or a business location;

NRD submission means information that is submitted under securities legislation or securities directions in NRD format, or the act of submitting information under securities legislation or securities directions in NRD format, as the context requires;
NRD website means the website operated by the NRD administrator for the NRD submissions.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Terms defined in NI 33-109 and used in this Instrument have the respective meanings ascribed to those terms in NI 33-109.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Information to Be Submitted in NRD Format

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person or company that is required to submit any of the following to the securities regulatory authority or regulator must make the submission in NRD format:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 5. Form 33-109F5 to report a change to any information previously submitted in respect of Form 33-109F4;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An NRD filer that is required under securities legislation to submit information in NRD format must make that NRD submission

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: through the NRD website,
using the NRD number of the NRD filer or business location, and
in accordance with this Instrument.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A requirement in securities legislation relating to the format in which a document or other information to be submitted must be printed, or specifying the number of copies of a document that must be submitted, does not apply to an NRD submission required to be made in accordance with this Instrument.
An NRD filer making an NRD submission must make the NRD submission through an AFR.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be enrolled with the NRD administrator to use NRD;
have one and no more than one chief AFR enrolled with the NRD administrator;
maintain one and no more than one NRD account;
notify the NRD administrator of the appointment of a chief AFR within 7 days of the appointment;
notify the NRD administrator of any change in the name of the firm's chief AFR within 7 days of the change;
submit any change in the name of an AFR, other than the firm's chief AFR, in NRD format within 7 days of the change; and
submit any change in the phone number, fax number or email address of the chief AFR in NRD format within 7 days of the change.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a fee is required with respect to an NRD submission, a firm filer must pay the required fee by electronic pre-authorized debit through NRD.
A payment under subsection (1) must be made from the firm filer's NRD account.
If an NRD filer is required to pay an annual registration fee, the NRD filer must pay the required fee by electronic pre-authorized debit through NRD.
A payment under subsection (1) must be made from the NRD filer's NRD account.

bcl:section.bcl:hnote: [am. B.C. Reg. 226/2009, Sch. L, s. 5 (a) and (b).]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payment of NRD user fees — annual

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a firm filer is required to pay an annual NRD user fee, the firm filer must pay the required fee by electronic pre-authorized debit through NRD.
A payment under subsection (1) must be made from the firm filer's NRD account.

If a firm filer is required to pay late filing fees because of an activity that creates or relates to an NRD submission, the firm filer must pay the required fee by electronic pre-authorized debit through NRD.
A payment under subsection (1) must be made from the firm filer's NRD account.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption for registrants not resident in Canada
bcl:section.bcl:text: Sections 3.2 (c), 4.1, 4.2, 4.3 and 4.4 do not apply to a registered firm that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has no business office in a jurisdiction of Canada,
does not have an account with a member of the Canadian Payments Association,
is not an affiliate of a registered firm resident in a jurisdiction of Canada,
pays the fees referred to in sections 4.1, 4.2 and 4.4 within 14 days of the date the payment is due,

pays the following fees within 14 days of the date the payment is due by submitting a cheque, payable to the Ontario Securities Commission in Canadian currency, to CSA Service Desk, Attn: NRD Administrator, 12 Millennium Blvd, Suite 210, Moncton, NB, E1C 0M3:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: NRD user fees required in respect of an NRD submission;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: pays any fee referred to in sections 4.1, 4.2 and 4.4, other than an NRD user fee, by submitting a cheque in Canadian funds to the securities regulatory authority or regulator in the local jurisdiction within 14 days of the date the payment is due.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If unanticipated technical difficulties prevent an NRD filer from making an NRD submission within the time required under securities legislation, the NRD filer is exempt from the requirement to make the submission within the required time period, if the NRD filer makes the submission other than through the NRD website or in NRD format no later than 7 days after the day on which the information was required to be submitted.
If unanticipated technical difficulties prevent an individual filer from submitting an application in NRD format, the individual filer may submit the application other than through the NRD website.
For the purpose of subsections (1) and (2), the NRD filer may make a notification or application other than through the NRD website by submitting it to the principal regulator.
Despite subsection (3), for the purpose of an application submitted under subsection (2) which includes Ontario, the individual filer may make the application by submitting it to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the principal regulator, if the principal jurisdiction is Ontario, or
the principal regulator and the regulator in Ontario.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If an NRD filer makes a submission other than through the NRD website under this section, the NRD filer must include the following legend in capital letters at the top of the first page of the submission:
IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 5.1 OF NATIONAL INSTRUMENT 31-102 NATIONAL REGISTRATION DATABASE (NRD), THIS [SPECIFY DOCUMENT] IS BEING SUBMITTED OTHER THAN THROUGH THE NRD WEBSITE UNDER A TEMPORARY HARDSHIP EXEMPTION.

If an NRD filer makes a submission other than through the NRD website under this section, the NRD filer must resubmit the information in NRD format as soon as practicable and in any event within 14 days after the unanticipated technical difficulties have been resolved.
The regulator or the securities regulatory authority may grant an exemption from this Instrument, in whole or in part, subject to such conditions or restrictions as may be imposed in the exemption.
Despite subsection (1), in Ontario only the regulator may grant such an exemption.

Except in Ontario, an exemption referred to in subsection (1) is granted under the statute referred to in Appendix B of National Instrument 14-101 Definitions opposite the name of the local jurisdiction.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Securities Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 418, section 184]
